abstract: Illegal drug called K2, blend of herbs and chemicals also known as synthetic marijuana, has swept homeless populations in Harlem; use is widespread in part due to its cheap price, at a dollar or two a joint, and availability in bodegas; stretch of 125th street between Park and Lexington Avenues, where many gather to get high, stands out along increasingly developed commercial strip and visually illustrates New York's homeless problem.
lead_paragraph: A cheap form of synthetic marijuana with vicious side effects has become popular with homeless people on 125th Street, and the block between Lexington and Park Avenues appears at times to be a street of zombies.

headline.main: K2, a Potent Drug, Casts a Shadow Over an East Harlem Block
headline.print_headline: On Harlem Block, Lost in a Cheap Drug’s Haze

snippet: A cheap form of synthetic marijuana with vicious side effects has become popular with homeless people on 125th Street, and the block between Lexington and Park Avenues appears at times to be a street of zombies.
